pr_title: Finish support for multiple LDAP / AD servers

timeline.message:
Finish support for multiple ldap / AD servers

 - Add support to verify against multiple hosts in DefaultX509TrustManager

 - modify connection test to support and test multiple servers

 - remove validation for single server

Fixes #1046

timeline.bodyText: How about validating that the servers list is not empty? That way we can prevent errors later on.
timeline.author: bernd
bernd
bernd

timeline.bodyText: Same as for the AD config, how about checking if the list is not empty?
timeline.author: bernd

timeline.bodyText: Is it actually okay to just check if the certificate matches any host in our list? I was wondering if this can be an issue because we don't know which host is giving us the certificate. So a host could give us the certificate of another host from our list.
timeline.author: bernd

replies.bodyText:
That's difficult to implement. I've added a javadoc comment to point this out.
However, in our scenario, if I trust to talk to any of the servers in the list, it shouldn't matter which certificate they provide.
replies.author: mpfz0r
